trailingComments.value:
*
 * A representation of any set of values over any amount of time. This the most basic building block
 * of RxJS.
 *
 * @class Observable<T>

leadingComments.value:
*
     * @constructor
     * @param {Function} subscribe the function that is  called when the Observable is
     * initially subscribed to. This function is given a Subscriber, to which new values
     * can be `next`ed, or an `error` method can be called to raise an error, or
     * `complete` can be called to notify of a successful completion.

trailingComments.value:
*
     * Creates a new Observable, with this Observable as the source, and the passed
     * operator defined as the new observable's operator.
     * @method lift
     * @param {Operator} operator the operator defining the operation to take on the observable
     * @return {Observable} a new observable with the Operator applied

leadingComments.value:
*
     * Creates a new Observable, with this Observable as the source, and the passed
     * operator defined as the new observable's operator.
     * @method lift
     * @param {Operator} operator the operator defining the operation to take on the observable
     * @return {Observable} a new observable with the Operator applied

trailingComments.value:
*
     * @method forEach
     * @param {Function} next a handler for each value emitted by the observable
     * @param {PromiseConstructor} [PromiseCtor] a constructor function used to instantiate the Promise
     * @return {Promise} a promise that either resolves on observable completion or
     *  rejects with the handled error

leadingComments.value: if there is a subscription, then we can surmise
the next handling is asynchronous. Any errors thrown
need to be rejected explicitly and unsubscribe must be
if there is NO subscription, then we're getting a nexted
value synchronously during subscription. We can just call it.
If it errors, Observable's `subscribe` will ensure the
unsubscription logic is called, then synchronously rethrow the error.
After that, Promise will trap the error and send it

*
     * @method forEach
     * @param {Function} next a handler for each value emitted by the observable
     * @param {PromiseConstructor} [PromiseCtor] a constructor function used to instantiate the Promise
     * @return {Promise} a promise that either resolves on observable completion or
     *  rejects with the handled error

trailingComments.value:
*
     * An interop point defined by the es7-observable spec https://github.com/zenparsing/es-observable
     * @method Symbol.observable
     * @return {Observable} this instance of the observable

leadingComments.value:
*

     * @method Symbol.observable
     * @return {Observable} this instance of the observable

trailingComments.value: HACK: Since TypeScript inherits static properties too, we have to
fight against TypeScript here so Subject can have a different static create signature

*
     * Creates a new cold Observable by calling the Observable constructor
     * @static true
     * @owner Observable
     * @method create
     * @param {Function} subscribe? the subscriber function to be passed to the Observable constructor
     * @return {Observable} a new cold observable

leadingComments.value: HACK: Since TypeScript inherits static properties too, we have to
fight against TypeScript here so Subject can have a different static create signature

*
     * Creates a new cold Observable by calling the Observable constructor
     * @static true
     * @owner Observable
     * @method create
     * @param {Function} subscribe? the subscriber function to be passed to the Observable constructor
     * @return {Observable} a new cold observable

comments.value:
*
 * A representation of any set of values over any amount of time. This the most basic building block
 * of RxJS.
 *
 * @class Observable<T>

*
     * @constructor
     * @param {Function} subscribe the function that is  called when the Observable is
     * initially subscribed to. This function is given a Subscriber, to which new values
     * can be `next`ed, or an `error` method can be called to raise an error, or
     * `complete` can be called to notify of a successful completion.

*
     * Creates a new Observable, with this Observable as the source, and the passed
     * operator defined as the new observable's operator.
     * @method lift
     * @param {Operator} operator the operator defining the operation to take on the observable
     * @return {Observable} a new observable with the Operator applied

*
     * @method forEach
     * @param {Function} next a handler for each value emitted by the observable
     * @param {PromiseConstructor} [PromiseCtor] a constructor function used to instantiate the Promise
     * @return {Promise} a promise that either resolves on observable completion or
     *  rejects with the handled error
if there is a subscription, then we can surmise
the next handling is asynchronous. Any errors thrown
need to be rejected explicitly and unsubscribe must be
if there is NO subscription, then we're getting a nexted
value synchronously during subscription. We can just call it.
If it errors, Observable's `subscribe` will ensure the
unsubscription logic is called, then synchronously rethrow the error.
After that, Promise will trap the error and send it

*
     * An interop point defined by the es7-observable spec https://github.com/zenparsing/es-observable
     * @method Symbol.observable
     * @return {Observable} this instance of the observable
HACK: Since TypeScript inherits static properties too, we have to
fight against TypeScript here so Subject can have a different static create signature

*
     * Creates a new cold Observable by calling the Observable constructor
     * @static true
     * @owner Observable
     * @method create
     * @param {Function} subscribe? the subscriber function to be passed to the Observable constructor
     * @return {Observable} a new cold observable
